Review: The course includes 4 and half year and one year compulsory internship, teachers are too good and helpful, the study environment is too good, all the teachers are highly educated, there is a total of 9 semesters which ars compulsory to pass and passing criteria is minimum of 50% marks requires, and attendance is 75% minimum.

Name: Manjima Ghosh
Heading: Review for my College : Lady Brabourne - An Excellent College for Women
Review:
The Fest is generally conducted around February, though at times it is conducted in mid of the year also. Artists come to attend those fests.
Books are available plenty in an amount in the Library. It is accessible and open to all. The Library is quite large.
Classrooms are moderately spaced, with good air, and the environment around the college is very soothing with trees here and there. 
Sports Competitions are conducted every year, with prizes available for the First, Second and Third Positions. 
Groups are here run by the Students, but there is no Political Influence here.

Name: Drishti miglani
College: Sri Guru Tegh Bahadur Khalsa College - [SGTB]
Heading: Great experience of studying here
Review: From the 4th semester, students become eligible for placements. KPMG, DELOITTE, TCS are the main recruiters which come to the college for the campus placement, total offers made were 150. Talking about the packages highest was 12 LPA, the lowest 3 LPA and the average package was 5 LPA. Percentage of students getting placements-7-8 cgpa. My Plans after graduation-Civil services preparation.

Name: Raman
Heading: Overall NSUT is a placement Heaven
Review:
College life overall amazing, with fest being organised on a regular basis. Moksha which is a flagship fest of NSUT is organised every year and invites various Indian and international artists and college groups to perform.
The library is a decent one with a large collection of books. You will not have any difficulty finding a book for your course in the library. 
Classrooms are decent and well up to dated, on par with how a college classroom should be. With the new apj lecture hall being a top of the class infrastructure. There is an active sports committee that organises sports fests on a regular basis. With winter sports in the month of Jan and summer sports around august or September.
There are a lot of student clubs and societies in which students can enrol. You'll have a decent interaction with your seniors, so you won't feel left out in the college.

Name: Sneha k
Heading: JNC
Review:
I chose my course a triple degree of B.sc Psychology, Journalism and Computer science because it has a wide range of opportunities for me to choose from. 
The faculty: student ratio is pretty decent. We have various lecturers teaching us the same subject.
The teaching method of the teachers is pretty good. The term exams are difficult only if unprepared. It is pretty easy for students that have regularly attended classes and kept a track of their CIA marks to get through the exams. There is one mid semester examination and a class test along with an assignment in each subject be it language or electives or the core subjects.

Name: Sri Vikram
College: Hindusthan College of Arts and Science- [HICAS]
Heading: My anotomic college life
Review:
1. I took a bachelor in science (information technology) I took this course because I love working on computers not to play games but also to do some logical work like practising programming.

4. Term exams time was 3 hours and it was quite easier to pass only the answer you know will ask in the exams so, only thing is to listen in class with little sincerity and with more friendly.

Heading: This is the best college In murshidabad Krishnath College

Heading: Cure injuries doing BPT course

Name: Somya mendiratta
College: Fairfield Institute of Management and Technology - [FIMT]
Heading: Good college in delhi
Review:
I chose LLB because I am having an interest in Litigation.
In our course, there are approx 200 students and there are 6_7 teachers for us.
Teachers are highly experienced and share their experiences with us too. The teaching method of our teachers are good as they explain in very easy language.
We are having exams two times that are internal and external. They are not too easy nor too tough. Anyone can pass with they study the college notes and listen to all lectures.

Name: Kakoli Sharma
Heading: B.P.E course in MLSU
Review: The entire syllabus has a duration of 3 years. In paper1, there is the history of physical education. Anatomy, Physiology, Exercise Physiology, Kinesiology, etc are taught in the 2nd and 3rd papers. It has 200 working days per year. B.P.E program has a total of 90 credits and for each semester there are 20 credits.

Name: Tashi Ongmu Sherpa
Heading: College Review
Review:
I chose to take Tourism honors as it is one of my favorite subjects since I was studying in class 9. Is it a service-providing sector.
The faculty out here are really outstanding. They guide us by providing notes by explaining every little word. They never miss their class.
The exam's time was from 10;30-11;30.
Questions were not that tough.

Name: AMIT SINGH
Heading: Review of -IEM College
Review:
IEM does not provide any fest. This is the main con.
There are lots of books that you can read there are a maximum of books written by the faculty members of our college(IEM KOLKATA).

After coming to this college there are lots of groups that you should participate in and get some knowledge that can help you in the future.

Name: Student (Anonymous)
Heading: Life at Coochbehar Government Engineering College
Review:
From the third semester, students become eligible for campus placement in this college.
Desi are approximately 35 companies visited this college & approximately 350 offers were made to the students of this college.
Last year the highest salary package was 10 lakh per annum and the average salary package was 4 lakh per annum.
Last year almost 55% students God Placement in different companies from this college. This number is quite less because most of the people choose for higher studies after pursuing their graduation.
I want to go for higher studies after completing my graduation from this college.

Name: Arun raj
Heading: The life changing engineering college.
Review: From 7 semester, students are eligible for college placements.  The companies that came for placement is TCS, Accenture, Bosch, etc with a minimum package of 3 LPA and with a maximum package of 45 LPA. The college placements are above average. My plans after my degree are to apply for a higher degree.

Name: Bhakti Sharma
Heading: Get an inside perspective about JNTUH
Review:
The Training & Placement Cell of Jawaharlal Nehru Technological University is a section of UIIC dedicated to offering all feasible help to its top-ranked students as well as satisfying the demands of enterprises. The Training & Placement Cell is led by a professor who serves as the Training & Placement Officer in Charge, with Student Placement Coordinators assisting him. The cell hosts pre-placement seminars, online examinations, internship awareness programmes, and training sessions for students in order to familiarise them with the business and assist them in grooming and becoming industry-ready.
The 2021 placements at JNTUH are excellent. However, the placement results for the year 2021 have not yet been disclosed, however, Microsoft has awarded the institute the highest CTC of INR 41 LPA.
Moreover, 64 companies participated in the placement drive of 2020 some of them are Amazon, Oracle, TCS, Invesco, etc.

Name: K Faninder Reddy
College: Vel Tech Rangarajan Dr. Sagunthala R and D Institute of Science and Technology - [Vel Tech]
Heading: College Review
Review: Events are conducted Every month,Annual fest is conducted in every 2yrs in March. Veltech is just awesome. Every department has its seperate library , students can use by  there ID cards no fees is required . Every class has a white and black board , projector,wifi router. Some classes have benches,chairs and round tables . College has a play group ,a basketball ground. Sports goes on daily. There is NSS which performs extracurricular ,social activities.there is dance club and NCC. every group has its own social media account. These groups are run by students.

Name: Himanshu Mittal
Heading: A place to learn and grow

As this is only the second cohort of this course the first placement of this course still needs to happen in 2023-24.
From Microsoft, Adobe to JPMorgan many big fat companies take part in the recruitment drive.
100 % placements, thats what VIT says. My plan is to pursue a startup after acquiring the skillsets from the degree.

Name: kriti kukureja
College: Institute of Public Health and Hygiene - [IPHH]
Heading: Institute has variety of diploma courses
Review: It was my dream to work in a hospital but not as a medical staff so i have chosen this course. IPHH has an average 1 faculty members on every 10th student. They have different faculty for classroom teaching and lab teaching. Most of the faculty of the institute are doctors. The teaching method is good, faculty mostly focus on practical knowledge and internship so that students can gain more industry knowledge.

Name: Rajeshwar
Heading: One of The best college in karnataka
Review: From 6 sem students are allowed to get internship and sit for placements for on campus. Many companies visited our college like adobe, flipkart, Amazon, wipro, tcs, Infosys, jp Morgan, goldman Sachs, Microsoft. Highest package offerd was 43 lahks ctc lpa by Microsoft. And average is about 8 ctc lpa. And lowest is 6 ctc lpa. 100% of them get placed in our department.

Name: Rahul
College: Sreenidhi Institute of Science and Technology - [SNIST]
Heading: The story of journey in SNIST
Review: Sreevision, Adastra, Dandiya night etc. are the annual fests conducted which include technical events also. The books and journals are available in the college library. The classrooms have all the amenities required like a projector. Extracurricular activities are also encouraged. Clubs like Techvision, start club, art club are run and organized by students.

Name: Samarth Nautiyal
College: University Institute of Engineering and Technology -[UIET]
Heading: Still in 2nd year
Review: Campus life is great! Students come from all over the country(though prominently North Indians), there is huge diversity. Goonj is our annual fest but you will find many fests going round the year, from technical to cultural. Then our library is also great, AC Joshi library is the library of the whole PU which can provide you books of any genre or any field you are interested in. Sports is something PU is known for, there must be a reason if it's awarded for sports. We have great facilities for sports, tennis court, hockey ground, football ground, basketball court and the list goes on. Apart from all, like other engineering colleges, there is a range of clubs.. from photography to alumni. Osmium, the theatre one, is the oldest among all the clubs

Name: Muskan Gupta
Heading: Software Engineering At DTU
Review: The course curriculum of software engineering is very nice. It has been designed keeping in view the software requirements in the industry. All the important subjects are covered in the curriculum. We can also take a minor of any course we like to do. There are plenty of subjects to choose from. The faculties are very well educated. The exams are conducted in the form of minor tests and surprise tests and class tests and projects.

Name: Student (Anonymous)
College: Sardar Vallabhbhai National Institute of Technology - [SVNIT]
Heading: College review
Review:
The fees structure for the Btech course is approximately 5,40,000 INR. There are many government scholarships available which students can apply for.
For students whose family income is between 1-5 lakh have to pay only 1/3rd of the fees, and those with income less than 1 lakh have to pay nothing.

Name: JAHIRUDDIN MOLLA
Heading: My experience in WBSU
Review:
I thought biochemistry might be a good subject for M.sc and I thought it will be a good subject to get a job in the technical field.
We had 5 professors in the Biochemistry department and we had around 36 students so we had around one professor for 6-7 students.

Our professors are very qualified. They have done a Ph.D. & won several awards in their field. They gave us all the study material needed in post-graduation. They are very willing to teach us practical so we understand the subject deeply.

They did some audiovisual classes and organized several seminars both online & offline.
We had one final exam every semester. You have to study a lot to pass & get good marks.

Name: Prateek Martin
Heading: IMS- Yes or No
Review:
1) Through the application form I opted for my course. (B.B.A).
2) There are many faculty. All faculty are best. Good quality teaching. The number of students is approximately 350 or more in my course. There are enough faculty for students.
3) Some are CA, Some are Ph.D. Teachers are the best you can get. Quality teaching.
4) Do to all covid problems exams are all late. Internal exams are good on time but easy to pass. External exams are also easy to pass.

Name: Rimmy jain
College: Fairfield Institute of Management and Technology - [FIMT]
Heading: Good college at reasonable fees
Review: I chose this course because I have always wanted to become a teacher. B.ed help in to get private and goverment teaching job. All faculty members for our subject are nice and helpful. Few faculty members help in getting jobs also by their own contacts in school or alumni. Qualification of teachers are good and most of are M.ed or P.hd holder. The teaching method is mostly based on practical knowledge.

Name: Tanish
Heading: Is PIET considerate
Review: The college campus is actually great. Recently there was a feat called carbuncle which was awesome and we enjoyed it a lot, there are so many fests and workshops organized in this college which is actually a great way to learn and move forward in your life.

Name: Chirag Routaray
Heading: Silicon Institute of Technology, Bhubaneswar
Review:
My ambition is to be a programmer, thus Computer Science and Engineering is the best course available.

The ratio of Faculty Advisor to Student is = 1:15. And ratio of student to teacher in 1st year is approx. = 1:60.

Teachers are highly qualified, some of them even were a part of IITs, and thus they've high-quality teaching methods which are helpful for even those who didn't have pre-requisite knowledge for college level.

Silicon is well reputed for its scrict exam time schedule and conduct. And the term exam is a bit leveled as it aims to improve the students and shape them to become ready to implement it in real world.

But there's a downside i.e some faculties don't have proper teaching skills, so students have to struggle a bit, but most teachers are highly better than average.

Name: Abhir
College: P.U. Swami Sarvanand Giri Regional Centre - [PUSSGRC]
Heading: PUSSGRC UIET HOSHIARPUR REVIEW
Review: Faculty members are really helpful. They guide us a lot. The college provides good labs and courses are generalized in such a way that students could understand easily. All the teachers are experienced and are quite knowledgeable. Mid sem exams take place in a month's time and difficulty is set to average to hard varying subject to subject.

Name: Chinmay
Heading: My College Review till date
Review:
The KIITFEST is the annual fest of the institute and is held in the month of December, but due to the pandemic, the college did not host the fest in the past 2 years. The tech fest is also embedded in the annual fest here at KIIT.
The library is a full AC library that is open for students round the clock (24/7) and has around a 1.1million books including reference books with textbooks and over 4million+ E-journals etc. There is a photocopy service as well which opens from 9 AM to 6 PM on working days.
Also, you can remote excess the library through RemoteXs software which is not much developed but does the work sometimes.
There is an online IEL service for students where they can avail themselves of many books and journals online and many more facilities.
KIIT offers immense opportunities for students interested in sports and fitness and was even a host for Khelo India 2020.
There are sports facilities on almost all the campuses and the timings are typically from 6 AM-9AM and 3PM-9PM.

Name: Bijita Panja
Heading: Best  college for Agriculture (ICAR affiliated)
Review: Yearly tuition fees Rs170000/.  Admission fees Rs10000/. Hostel lodging fees Rs55000/ and flooding fees Rs30000/. Veg and nonveg both are available at Hostel. Scholarship Rs 15000.00 per years for students secured 80%marks in both10th and 12th examinations

Name: Kunal Dagar
College: Manav Rachna International Institute of Research and Studies - [MRIIRS]
Heading: College Review
Review: The fees for my course was initially around 221000 but as I scored 82% in class 12th so I got 25% scholorship in the tution fee and my fees got to around 207000 per year . The scholarship criteria is very simple if you got more than 80% you will get 25% scholorship, for 85% it's 50 % and above 90% it's may be 90% or 100% but in the tution fee .

Name: Student (Anonymous)
College: National College Of Arts And Science
Heading: Affordable college with many features and support.
Review: At first, I was expecting that the fees in this college were very expensive but the reality was it was less as compared to my expectations. There is no such fees price hike the fees were constant throughout my course 10,000/semester. They also provide and promotes scholarship for students studying there and is easy to apply and good for students. I have seen many seniors getting placement in top companies like Mahindra motors, Infopark etc.

Name: Student (Anonymous)
Heading: Jadavpur University Reveiw
Review:
Two fests apart from freshers are conducted every year . Sanskriti is the cultural fest that is held in March which includes dances and musical performances .
Srijan is the name of the Tech fest which consists of a number of events for the students to participate in. Both campuses have a well-equipped library and have all basic sports infrastructure.
JU has a lot of clubs like Science , dance , Photography,Hiking, debating, codeclub .

Name: Siddharth Srivastava
Heading: Complete and Honest words about my National Institute of Technology Patna
Review:
Sadly my batch haven't got a chance to visit our college since the beginning, so I got nothing to say about college infrastructure and social life there.

But though being online, activities continue with full enthusiasm. There are various Clubs that are very active in organizing various activities.

There are Google Affiliated Clubs Google DSC and Hackslash Clubs which give a lot of opportunities to students.

There are clubs related to all domains and Interests like Drama Club, Art and Literary Club, IEEE Club, and clubs for racing and aviation where we get to make racing cars and RC airplanes and compete in national level competitions.

Name: PRASHANT RAJ
Heading: Lovely professional University
Review: The cost of the study is 58800 per semester. The hike in fee is not too much. The scholarship is lpunest. It's to give exposure to students and give them training to get placements in top companies. The scholarship is too easy to gain because the questions are from the 11th and 12th syllabus so you can avail maximum scholarship that the university provides.

Name: Inukurthi Sai Ramakrishna Teja
Heading: Internships
Review:
Campus Life is very good. We have annual fests, tech fests, workshops, etc which are exciting. And even there is a great atmosphere in the campus.
Almost all types of books needed for the academy are available in the library. Classrooms are decent and are provided with A/c(for some classes only) and a projector(for almost all classes) which helps a lot. Sports and extracurricular activities on the campus are very good. We are provided with excellent facilities in the campus for various sports equipment. We even have student clubs such as GUSAC, Kalakriti which are of different genre and interested students can join.

Name: Sahil Pahwa
Heading: SRM UNIVERSITY HONEST REVIEWS
Review:
There are a lot of clubs, for every activity they have a club which conducts events regularly. Every week the clubs are conducting some of the other events. The interactive club proved to be the most beneficial for students as they got a huge opportunity there to express themselves and it was good exposure for beginners.

Name: SURYA DEVI S

Name: Ash

Name: SAIKRISHNA

Name: Student (Anonymous)
Heading: Expect everything from the college except internships and placements
Review:
Courses are good and related to your allotted branch. The CS branches in the college(CSE, IT, CE) have almost similar courses.
Coming to the faculty, you have qualified professors, with MTech and PhDs, some from the IITs but they won't be teaching you all the courses, you will be getting assistant teachers(including MTech students) for half of your courses. Senior professors are well versed with their teaching and won't disappoint you, just following their lectures can get you good grades in your semester, but the assistant teachers are pathetic in their work. In my five-semester experience, I have been getting at least one or two such teachers each semester. They are irregular in taking classes, bad in their teaching ways, and don't even care. MTech students just take classes for the sake of a stipend. I would advise you to avoid such teachers, if possible.
We have a mid sem exam, 2 quizzes, and an end sem exam each semester. Exams are easy to pass for most subjects, previous year papers FTW.

Name: Gnanendra Reddy
College: Rajiv Gandhi University of Knowledge Technologies, RK Valley Idupulapaya Campus - [RGUKT]
Heading: My life in my collage.
Review: I was studying civil engineering now. So I would like to share my opinion s on the civil engineering faculty and their qualification. Two semesters per year are there. In every semester we have a sufficient curriculum and syllabus. Before I choose this course, I searched many points about branches finally I go with civil engineering. In this course, the total number of students is 468 and the faculty number is 9 . So, the ratio is 9:468.most of the faculty are done m tech. And their teaching method was good. We have three mid exams and one end semester exam. In these exams, the exam paper depends on the respective faculty or preparation of students.

Name: Student (Anonymous)
College: University of Petroleum and Energy Studies - [UPES]
Heading: Review from the student who is currently studying here.
Review: The course curriculum is quite up to date and it is very vast as well as related to the industry. Though I am specializing in AIML still they teach us a little about every domain related to computer science so that we have known about everything resulting in the higher package. As companies nowadays don't prefer people who are specific to only one domain they want people who can be beneficial for their organization in multiple ways. The faculty I have come across with have a wide knowledge on the subject they are teaching almost every faculty has written at least one research paper. With the help of these faculties, many students have written their own research papers while being in their 2nd or 3rd year. Their teaching method is quite sophisticated yes you may come across overall the teaching faculty is quite knowledgeable here. Exams have never been delayed and yes you have to study to pass the exam. The exam level is moderate.

Name: Bittu kumar
Heading: Gulzaar group is best institute
Review: The fee wasn't hiked at all over the course of the three years that I've been here. The cost to study was 159000 rs per annum for normal BTech but for specialised courses, be ready to shell out 10k more. No such concept as On-campus job with a stipend. The fest takes place between the summer and the monsoon season. The library has been recently modified and it's actually great with PC availability now. Plenty of books to read. Classrooms are equipped with wifi and there's a projector in every classroom. The sports culture is great.

Name: Khavali Rakesh
College: Keshav Memorial Institute of Commerce and Sciences - [KMICS]
Heading: Better than ever helpful for the readers. Neat and clean
Review: The campus life is fun where students talk about the important issues and they solve their problems. The annual fest which is common in every college is First and foremost is freshers day, farewell day, Youth day. In the college, the students can visit the library by showing their id cards. The students can spend their time in the library to gain some knowledge. The extracurricular activities are Ncc and Nss. When it comes to clubs the students are leaders of the club. There are different clubs like a cultural club, sports club, literacy club.

Name: Rachit Bijalwan
Heading: Review
Review: Some students are offered 30,000 per month, and some get 1 Lac per month. Some may even get more, but everything depends on the talent of the student. As it is planning, you can't estimate the package as you can estimate for engineering students, but the highest package can be 30 LPA, and the average package maybe 10 LPA. The lowest package maybe 2 LPA. The top recruiting companies are GMR Constructions, Somaya and Kalappa Consultants, Mind Space Architects etc.

Name: Nandini shah
Heading: Internship opportunities are good
Review: I have opted for this course because I have an interest in medicines that how they work in our body and what is the mechanism behind it as well as how they are manufactured so due to this reason I chose to do this course faculty members are good but some of them are very strict student ratio is about 3000-4000. Qualification of a faculty member is Master in pharmacy, some of them have done Ph.D. as well. The teaching method is good they provide full knowledge about the thing they teach but the problem is that they use slide during classes which make sometimes difficult for the student to understand the thing they are teaching because the slide contains only a few lines instead of slide book should be used so that student can know about where the topic is.  In a sem, three Mid-sem examinations will be conducted out of three students have to give any two because best if any two is going to be added internals. It's so difficult to pass the exam because alot of things have to do in time.

Name: Kumar
Heading: Life of a Christit
Review: I have taken BCA (Bachelors in Computer Application) because I am interested in computers. I had always wanted to code and get involved in animation and graphics. Christ University is very well known for having the no.1 BCA program in India so this was more than enough for me to select christ college. The faculty to student ratio is 2:6. There are a lot of students, and the place is always crowded. The faculty are very skilled and motivating members. They are always asking the students to try doing new things and take part in all the events and functions that take place on campus. Their teaching method is very good since they provide notes and explain the concepts really well. I wrote my end sem exam for the first time offline and I think the questions seem easy but they are tricky. It's really hard to get a 95+.

Name: Kunal Jajure
College: Deogiri Institute of Engineering and Management Studies - [DIEMS]
Heading: Best engineering college in Marathwada region.
Review:
Teaching is very good. Highly qualified teachers and head of the department.
the curriculum is very good, it has all the trending topics in technology and as well as personality development, humanities, mathematics.
This college provides complete guidance and resources for your career.

Name: Tina Dey
Heading: Read BA Jyotir Vigyan with special interest
Review: The highest package starts with Rs 5 lacs and the average package is Rs 3.10 lacs. Wipro, Cognizant, HCL, TCS, etc offer lucrative packages. The placement demand of the institute is getting better day by day.

Name: Abdulla sekh
Heading: The Dream of life
Review: I chose the course because I want to be a good doctor. This college is near to my hometown. The student-faculty ratio is 150:25.  All the faculties are already passed doctors so they very well in teaching, they teach us in projector board. Professors are very helpful. Sometimes they give extra time to solve our doubt. After every 3 month they conduct semester exams and after completion of the session, they conduct University exams also known as professional exams.

Name: Manisha Tolla
Heading: Study B.Optom in TMU
Review: All the students of the TMU get tuition fee exemption in the form of scholarships. 100% scholarship is provided for the students of Jainology Program. There was a scholarship for sportspersons for the academic year of 2019-2020. Besides, disabled students can also get scholarships from the institute. Students can get one scholarship at a time duration.

Name: Kabeer Khan
Heading: B.Tech Food Technology course in SVSU
Review: The institute gives positive feedback about placement. It is trying to build a reputation at the national level. The highest package is decent as Rs 10 LPA for market standard and the average package is Rs 5 LPA. The names of recruiting companies are Amazon, Axis Bank, Honda, Cognizant, Adobe, etc.

Name: Sahil verma
Heading: Review about Dav college abohar.
Review:
Basically, I have an interest in computer programming lines, so I did.  Student ratio is much equal like In my section, we have 64 students, 35 boys, and 29 girls. And I think all classes have this ratio. 
The teaching staff is very good, friendly, kind and highly qualified. After six months we have a semester exam and every 3 months we have a house test.

Name: Student (Anonymous)
Heading: My experience with Taki College
Review:
In our Government, college fees are very low in general. The admission fee was Rs 2600 and for the 2nd and 3rd-year cost is Rs 1650.

The total cost of the study is Rs 6000 approx.

The college fee does not increase normally. And we don't have any other extra fees for different programs.

College does not give any support financially. But we have several scholarships available like Swami Vivekananda Scholarship, OASIS scholarship.

For girls, there is a Kanyashree scholarship. As this is not an engineering college no job placement is offered from college.

For indoor sports, there are two options table tennis and carrom and for outdoor it's cricket. The college has its own website.

Name: Jainam Khandala
Heading: Review of L.M. College of pharmacy
Review: From 8th-semester students become eligible for campus placement. Our college placement is very nice. The highest package is 100000 and average package is 30000. At 8.5 percentage of students can getting placement. And my plan is becoming drug inspector after getting the degree

Name: shrikriti
Heading: College Review
Review:
Invertis University is the only college that has BJMC in Bareilly, other colleges has masters in journalism and mass communication. Though they don't have a media lab in real but they mentioned it in brochure.
There are 5 faculties in BJMC. 
Faculties are not good now, they don't teach well.
But when I took admission in 2018, faculty was good.
2 times exam and 2 times unit tests in each semester.
If you're studying then exams are easy otherwise you'll get a backlog.

Name: Student (Anonymous)
Heading: Best college for graduate students
Review:

The ratio for faculty and student is 1:30.
This is very good for us we can enjoy every class without uncomfortable.
The faculty is good they are friendly and also talented by their experience.
